page.title: 14Life At Home.
page.content: Many people have large gardens and produce their own vegetables. Fresh crops are preserved in freezers and little convenience food is eaten. Most families tend to enjoy simple menus. We discovered an unusual dish called Gloucester Pie consisting of sausages, apples, hard boiled eggs and cider. Some people keep chickens and rabbits for the table and some wild rabbits, hares and pigeons are also caught and used in traditional recipes. Watching television is a popular pastime among the older and younger people, whilst others enjoy whist drives and bingo sessions. We found that most people had lots of hobbies, including playing bridge, making corn dollies, writing, wind surfing and hunting with the Ledbury Hunt, which has its kennels just outside the village of Bromesberrow.
